page.title: 01Sollom, West Lancashire
page.content: Bounded by the villages of Rufford, Tarleton and Croston, this farming and horticultural area supports a population of 912. Housing is mainly situated on the major roads, A565 and A59, together with isolated farms. Running paralles to the A59 are are the River Douglas and a branch of the Leeds to Liverpool canal, giving ultimate access to the Irish Sea. The Preston/Liverpool railway intersects the south eastern tip of the area. Ancient field tracks, still in use, cross the fertile mossland. A private nudist colony has been established for many years (see leisure life recreation).
